problem_text:
a) Assume a group G is existentially closed in the class LNp of all locally finite p-groups. Is it true that G is characteristically simple? This is true for G countable in LNp (Berthold Maier, Freiburg); in fact, up to isomorphism, there is only one such countable locally finite p-group.
O. H. Kegel
answer: Not always (S. R. Thomas, Arch. Math., 44 (1985), 98–109).
